titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Patrick Welch, Indictment
CWG7312

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
AGAINST
Patrick Welch.
Jefferson Circuit Court,
September Term, A. D. 1865.

The Grand Jurors of the County of in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse Patrick Welch of the Crime of Grand Larceny committed in manner and form as follows, to=wit: The said Patrick Welch in the said County of Jefferson on the day of May A. D. 1865, with force and arms feloniously did take steal and carry away one hunting Case gold Watch worth One Hundred and fifty dollars ($150) the property of John M. Stokes Jr. contrary to the form of the statute in such cases, made and provided and against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Witnesses:
John M Stokes Jr
Thomas Welch (lives in New Albany)
Thomas Akers (Marshall of New Albany)

We of the Jury find the prisoner guilty as charged in the within Indictment and sentence him to confinement in the Jail and Penitentiary house for one year But we recommend him to the Clemency of the Governor
A Copy att Jas P. Chambers clk

The Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Indictment.
vs } Grand Larceny
Patrick Welch
A True Bill.
Joseph T. Tompkins
Foreman.
1865 Sept 5. Recieved from Grand Jury and filed
